clip-path.name: clip-path
clip-path.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
clip-path.computedValue: as specified, but with <url> values made absolute

mask-image.name: mask-image
mask-image.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-image.computedValue: the keyword none, a computed <image>, or a computed <url>

mask-mode.name: mask-mode
mask-mode.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

mask-repeat.name: mask-repeat
mask-repeat.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-repeat.computedValue: Consists of: two keywords, one per dimension

mask-position.name: mask-position
mask-position.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-position.percentages: refer to size of mask painting area minus size of mask layer image; see text background-position [CSS3BG]
mask-position.computedValue: Consisting of: two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a <length>), otherwise as a percentage.

mask-clip.name: mask-clip
mask-clip.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

mask-origin.name: mask-origin
mask-origin.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

mask-size.name: mask-size
mask-size.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-size.computedValue: as specified, but with lengths made absolute

mask-composite.name: mask-composite
mask-composite.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements without the defs element and all graphics elements

mask.name: mask
mask.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

mask-border-source.name: mask-border-source
mask-border-source.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-border-source.computedValue: they keyword none or the computed <image>

mask-border-mode.name: mask-border-mode
mask-border-mode.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

mask-border-slice.name: mask-border-slice
mask-border-slice.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-border-slice.percentages: refer to size of the mask border image

mask-border-width.name: mask-border-width
mask-border-width.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-border-width.percentages: relative to width/height of the mask border image area
mask-border-width.computedValue: all <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified

mask-border-outset.name: mask-border-outset
mask-border-outset.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element
mask-border-outset.computedValue: all <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified

mask-border-repeat.name: mask-border-repeat
mask-border-repeat.appliesTo: All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the defs element, all graphics elements and the use element

clip.name: clip
clip.appliesTo: Absolutely positioned elements. In SVG, it applies to elements which establish a new viewport, pattern elements and mask elements.

<top>.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the element’s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the element’s border box).

<right>.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the element’s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the element’s border box).

<bottom>.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the element’s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the element’s border box).

<left>.prose: <top>, <right>, <bottom>, and <left> may either have a <length> value or auto. Negative lengths are permitted. The value auto means that a given edge of the clipping region will be the same as the edge of the element’s generated border box (i.e., auto means the same as 0 for <top> and <left>, the same as the used value of the height plus the sum of vertical padding and border widths for <bottom>, and the same as the used value of the width plus the sum of the horizontal padding and border widths for <right>, such that four auto values result in the clipping region being the same as the element’s border box).
